question_details.title: Will Donald Trump visit Russia after the launch of this question and before April 1, 2025?
question_details.description: Wikipedia: [List of international presidential trips made by Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_international_presidential_trips_made_by_Donald_Trump)
question_details.resolution_criteria: This question resolves as **Yes** if, after the launch of this question and before April 1, 2025, President Donald Trump personally visits Russia.

news:
Here are the relevant news articles:

**Ukraine's Zelenskiy to visit South Africa for talks in April**
Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskiy will visit South Africa on April 10 to hold talks with President Cyril Ramaphosa. This comes after the U.S. halted all military aid to Ukraine, and as Zelenskiy tries to shore up international support. South Africa has maintained good relations with Russia, despite not condemning Russia's invasion of Ukraine three years ago. According to spokesman Vincent Magwenya, the visit is part of ongoing efforts to find a path to peace between Russia and Ukraine. Zelenskiy's visit comes at a pivotal moment in the war, following his public feud with Donald Trump and the U.S. decision to halt military aid to Kyiv.
Original language: en
Publish date: March 07, 2025 10:20 AM
Source:[Yahoo](https://ca.news.yahoo.com/ukraines-zelenskiy-visit-south-africa-101438244.html)

**Zelensky to Visit South Africa Next Month to Discuss Ukraine-Russia Peace**
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky is set to visit South Africa next month, according to Bloomberg. Zelensky will meet with South African President Cyril Ramaphosa on April 10 to discuss efforts to end the Russian war against Ukraine. 'The visit is a continuation of the current agreements between President Ramaphosa and Presidents Putin and Zelensky on an inclusive peace process that will provide a path to peace between Russia and Ukraine,' said Ramaphosa's spokesperson. South Africa has maintained a neutral stance on the war in Ukraine. Ramaphosa launched a peace initiative two years ago, but it has not yielded results. The meeting between Zelensky and Ramaphosa comes at a time when they are trying to improve relations with US President Donald Trump.
Original language: uk
Publish date: March 07, 2025 09:20 AM
Source:[РБК-Украина](https://www.rbc.ua/rus/news/zelenskiy-nastupnogo-misyatsya-vidvidae-pivdennu-1741339127.html)

**Russia Launches Airstrikes on Ukraine's Energy Infrastructure Ahead of Saudi Arabia Meeting**
Russia has launched massive airstrikes on Ukraine's energy infrastructure in anticipation of a meeting between US and Ukrainian delegations in Saudi Arabia on Tuesday. The meeting, which comes after a summit of 27 European leaders in Brussels who expressed a desire to strengthen the continent's defense capabilities in the wake of Washington's disengagement from the conflict, aims to establish 'a framework for a peace agreement and an initial ceasefire', according to US envoy to the Middle East, Steve Witkoff. Ukrainian President Zelensky announced that he will travel to Saudi Arabia on Monday to meet with Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, stating that 'my team will remain in Saudi Arabia to work with our American partners' to achieve a 'swift and lasting peace' to end the Russian invasion. Meanwhile, Donald Trump has also announced plans to visit Saudi Arabia, although a specific date has not been provided.
Original language: it
Publish date: March 07, 2025 08:53 AM
Source:[QuotidianoNet](https://www.quotidiano.net/esteri/guerra-ucraina-russia-news-gtq968dc)

**Trump Announces Visit to Saudi Arabia Amid Ongoing War Between Russia and Ukraine**
US President Donald Trump announced that he will visit Saudi Arabia within a month or a month and a half, citing the kingdom's agreement to invest $1 trillion in American companies over four years. Trump stated, 'I told them (the Saudis) that I will go if you invest $1 trillion in American companies over four years, and they agreed to do so, so I will go there.' Trump added that the Saudi investments will be for 'buying military equipment and other things.' He described his relationship with the Saudis as 'great.' Trump mentioned that his visit to Saudi Arabia will be one of his first foreign trips since taking office in January 2024. He also stated that he will visit the kingdom before the UK, which is his usual first destination. In 2017, Trump visited Saudi Arabia in his first foreign trip as president, where he received a grand welcome and secured deals and investments worth over $380 billion in various fields, which was a 10-year investment. Regarding the ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine, Trump stated that Ukraine 'wants to reach an agreement.' He considered that Kiev 'has no other option' but to end the war, and that Russia also 'wants to reach an agreement.' Trump added that Russia 'has a different way that no one knows except me and myself,' and that it also 'has no other option.' When asked about the possibility of revoking the temporary legal status of over 200,000 Ukrainians in the US who fled the war, Trump said that he will make a decision 'very soon.' He added that 'we do not want to harm anyone, and we will look into this matter.' Meanwhile, Trump's special envoy to the Middle East, Steve Witkoff, announced that Saudi Arabia will host a meeting between American and Ukrainian officials next week to discuss the war between Russia and Ukraine.
Original language: ar
Publish date: March 07, 2025 07:56 AM
Source:[Anadolu Ajansı](https://www.aa.com.tr/ar/%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%AF%D9%88%D9%84-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B9%D8%B1%D8%A8%D9%8A%D8%A9/%D8%AA%D8%B1%D8%A7%D9%85%D8%A8-%D8%B3%D8%A3%D8%B2%D9%88%D8%B1-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B3%D8%B9%D9%88%D8%AF%D9%8A%D8%A9-%D8%A8%D8%B9%D8%AF%D9%85%D8%A7-%D9%88%D8%A7%D9%81%D9%82%D8%AA-%D8%B9%D9%84%D9%89-%D8%A7%D8%B3%D8%AA%D8%AB%D9%85%D8%A7%D8%B1%D8%A7%D8%AA-%D8%A8%D8%AA%D8%B1%D9%8A%D9%84%D9%8A%D9%88%D9%86-%D8%AF%D9%88%D9%84%D8%A7%D8%B1/3502594)

**Trump to Visit Saudi Arabia in April, Breaking Tradition**
US President Donald Trump announced that he will visit Saudi Arabia in April, his first overseas trip. Trump stated, 'I have a good relationship with them, and they have been very kind to me. They will spend a lot of money on US companies to purchase military equipment and other goods.' This will be Trump's first foreign visit, breaking the tradition of previous US presidents visiting the UK as their first foreign destination. Trump is expected to meet with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Saudi Arabia, but the exact date of the meeting is not confirmed. Trump had his first phone call with a foreign leader, Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, after his inauguration in January. Bin Salman expressed his intention to invest $60 billion in the US over the next four years. Trump previously spoke at the Future Investment Initiative (FII) conference in Miami, hosted by the Saudi sovereign fund, where he referred to Saudi Arabia as a 'special country' and thanked them for hosting a high-level meeting between the US and Russia.
Original language: ko
Publish date: March 07, 2025 01:47 AM
Source:[뉴시스 (NEWSIS)](https://www.newsis.com/view/NISX20250307_0003089847)

**Trump to Visit Saudi Arabia, US and Ukraine Officials to Meet, Russia Refuses Temporary Ceasefire**
US President Donald Trump said it would be great if everyone could disarm nuclear weapons as they are a crazy power. Trump also announced that he will visit Saudi Arabia within a month and a half. The US State Department said that the presence of Hamas in Gaza makes it difficult to have a forward path. The Kremlin said that Europe will not win in the arms race against Russia. In Syria, a travel ban has been imposed in three provinces due to armed clashes. The European Central Bank has lowered interest rates by 0.25% for the sixth time in a row, to 2.65%. Over 85,000 Palestinians performed the evening and night prayers in the Al-Aqsa Mosque in Jerusalem. Russia's Foreign Ministry said that European countries will not succeed in the arms race against Russia as Moscow does not intend to participate in this race. Israel has announced that its medical electronic system has been exposed to a cyber attack. US and Ukrainian officials are expected to meet in Saudi Arabia next week. Russia has refused any temporary ceasefire and warned of the deployment of European forces in Ukraine. Norway has decided to increase its aid to Ukraine by 4.2 billion euros in 2025. Elon Musk said that Ukraine needs elections and Zelensky will lose with a large majority. Brazilian police wore Power Rangers costumes to catch thieves during the carnival. A report revealed that 'Mohammed' is the third most common name in Israel. The US is to execute a man by firing squad for the first time in 15 years. Israeli Defense Minister Yair Lapid threatened Hamas with 'unprecedented force' if they do not release all the hostages. A robot minaret has been launched to answer the questions of pilgrims in the holy mosques during Ramadan.
Original language: ar
Publish date: March 06, 2025 10:14 PM
Source:[اليوم السابع](https://www.youm7.com/story/2025/3/7/%D8%A8%D8%A7%D8%AE%D8%AA%D8%B5%D8%A7%D8%B1-%D8%A3%D9%87%D9%85-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%A3%D8%AE%D8%A8%D8%A7%D8%B1-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B9%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%85%D9%8A%D8%A9-%D9%88%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B9%D8%B1%D8%A8%D9%8A%D8%A9-%D8%AD%D8%AA%D9%89-%D9%85%D9%86%D8%AA%D8%B5%D9%81-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%84%D9%8A%D9%84-%D8%AA%D8%B1%D8%A7%D9%85%D8%A8-%D8%B3%D8%A3%D8%B2%D9%88%D8%B1/6908899)

**Zelensky to visit South Africa in April, says Presidency**
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky will visit South Africa on April 10th, according to the South African Presidency. The visit is a continuation of ongoing engagements between South African President Cyril Ramaphosa and Zelensky on an inclusive peace process between Russia and Ukraine. This comes after a long-awaited invitation for a state visit from South Africa. Zelensky and Ramaphosa previously met at the World Economic Forum in Davos to discuss the details of the visit. The announcement follows a tense meeting between Zelensky and US President Donald Trump, which resulted in the suspension of $1 billion in US military aid to Ukraine. European leaders are now working to salvage Ukraine's relationship with the US and bolster support for Ukraine in its conflict with Russia.
Original language: en
Publish date: March 06, 2025 09:21 PM
Source:[Daily Maverick](https://www.dailymaverick.co.za/article/2025-03-06-zelensky-to-visit-south-africa-in-april-says-presidency/)

**Trump: Zelensky is ready to negotiate for peace in Ukraine**
US President Donald Trump has stated that he received a message from Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky, expressing his regret for the heated exchange between them at the White House. Trump said that the message stated that Ukraine is ready to sit down at the negotiating table as soon as possible to reach a 'permanent peace' with Russia. Zelensky expressed his gratitude to the US for its assistance and acknowledged that his visit to the White House was not as expected. He proposed 'the first steps towards ending the war' which include releasing prisoners, a ceasefire that includes a ban on missile launches and long-range marches, and stopping attacks on civilian infrastructure, particularly energy facilities. Kiev has been willing to sign an agreement to exploit Ukrainian minerals in exchange for US assistance. Trump has received 'strong signals' that Russia is ready for peace. The US has frozen military aid to Ukraine, which has been a major supporter of the country since the Russian invasion in 2022. The EU has proposed a plan to 'rearm Europe' which would allow for rapid military assistance to Kiev. Russia has continued to attack Ukraine, targeting civilian infrastructure. The EU has proposed a plan to boost its defense spending, with a proposed budget of 800 billion euros. Germany has pledged to increase its defense spending by hundreds of billions of euros. German Chancellor Friedrich Merz said 'the price we pay for defense must be: whatever the cost'.
Original language: ar
Publish date: March 05, 2025 01:12 PM
Source:[SWI swissinfo.ch](https://www.swissinfo.ch/ara/%D8%AA%D8%B1%D8%A7%D9%85%D8%A8:-%D8%B2%D9%8A%D9%84%D9%8A%D9%86%D8%B3%D9%83%D9%8A-%D9%85%D8%B3%D8%AA%D8%B9%D8%AF-%D9%84%D9%84%D8%AA%D9%81%D8%A7%D9%88%D8%B6-%D9%85%D9%86-%D8%A3%D8%AC%D9%84-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B3%D9%84%D8%A7%D9%85-%D9%81%D9%8A-%D8%A3%D9%88%D9%83%D8%B1%D8%A7%D9%86%D9%8A%D8%A7/88965128)

**India Reschedules Russia Visit Amidst Trump's Tariff War**
India has rescheduled its visit to Russia amidst Donald Trump's tariff war. Indian Foreign Secretary Vijay Gokhale is set to visit Russia on March 7. The visit is crucial for India as it will review the comprehensive bilateral relations between India and Russia. According to sources, Gokhale will hold talks with his Russian counterpart and may also meet with top Russian leaders. This comes as Trump announced a 10% tariff on imported goods, including those from India, Japan, and South Korea, which will take effect on April 2. Trump called imported goods 'dirty and filthy' if they are not tested before entering the US. 'This is a significant development and India needs to be prepared to face the challenges that may arise from this decision,' said a source.
Original language: hi
Publish date: March 05, 2025 12:56 PM
Source:[Hindustan](https://www.livehindustan.com/national/indian-foreign-secretory-russia-tour-amid-trump-reciprocal-tariff-india-russia-relation-201741177247611.html)

**Trump Seeks Russian Mediation in Iran Talks Amid Growing Military Cooperation**
Russian rocket specialists visited Iran last year during a period of heightened tensions between the country and Israel. The visit, which included seven Russian experts with high military education, took place on two flights from Moscow to Tehran on April 24 and September 17, 2023. The experts, including two colonels and two lieutenant colonels, had expertise in various areas such as missile defense systems, artillery, and rocket technology. Their visit coincided with a difficult time for Iran, which was engaged in a confrontation with Israel, resulting in rocket attacks on both sides in April and October. A high-ranking official in Iran confirmed the visit, stating that the Russian specialists had visited Iranian rocket factories multiple times. The cooperation between Russia and Iran has intensified in the context of the special military operation, with the US sanctions and attempts to isolate both countries on the international stage contributing to their rapprochement. The US President Donald Trump has invited Russia to participate in negotiations on Iran, citing its military and trade ties with the country. According to Bloomberg, Russia has agreed to participate in the negotiations. Trump's initiative may be driven by his realization of the danger posed by the military cooperation between Moscow and Tehran.
Original language: ru
Publish date: March 04, 2025 03:14 PM
Source:[Телеканал Царьград](https://tsargrad.tv/dzen/tramp-vovremja-spohvatilsja-stalo-izvestno-o-vizitah-russkih-raketchikov-v-iran_1175515)

**Global News Update: Trump Rules Out Russia Visit, Europe Prepares for 'Triple Blow' in Support of Ukraine**
US President Donald Trump announced that he will not visit Russia on May 9. He also stated that the US will soon sign an agreement with Ukraine on rare earth metals, saying 'I think the Ukrainians want this.' Meanwhile, British Prime Minister Keir Starmer will announce a 'triple blow' in support of Ukraine on Monday, including additional military aid, a wide package of sanctions against Russia, and efforts to combat Russian dirty money. German candidate for Chancellor Friedrich Merz called for Europe to stop relying on US protection, saying 'We must be prepared for the possibility that US President Donald Trump may no longer adhere to NATO obligations to provide aid to Europe.' Merz also suggested negotiations with the UK and France on joint management of nuclear weapons. Additionally, the US will launch the SPHEREx telescope in March to study the first moments of the universe's existence, collecting data on the inflationary moment when space expanded by trillions of times in the first fractions of a second after the Big Bang.
Original language: ru
Publish date: February 22, 2025 05:41 AM
Source:[Interfax.ru](https://www.interfax.ru/world/1010275)

**Trump Rules Out Visit to Moscow for Victory Day Celebrations**
US President Donald Trump has responded to media discussions about his potential visit to Russia. Trump made a public statement, specifically answering journalists' questions about whether he will visit Moscow to celebrate the 80th anniversary of the Great Victory in the Great Patriotic War. 'No, I will not go,' Trump clearly stated, according to the White House pool. This statement comes after a French journal, Point, reported that Trump was allegedly planning to visit the Russian capital. However, there was no official information from the Kremlin or the White House about this. Meanwhile, Russian President's official representative, Dmitry Peskov, stated that there are no agreements between the Kremlin and the White House about Trump's possible visit to Moscow on May 9, 2025, to celebrate the 80th anniversary of the Great Victory.
Original language: ru
Publish date: February 21, 2025 11:13 PM
Source:[kp.ru](https://www.kp.ru/online/news/6244198/)

**Trump to Visit Russia on Victory Day, According to 'Le Point'**
According to the French weekly 'Le Point', US President Donald Trump is planning to visit Russia on Victory Day, May 9, 2025. The article suggests that if Trump's plan to negotiate a peace deal on Ukraine with Russia comes to fruition, it would be a victory for Russian President Vladimir Putin, who has compared Ukrainians to Nazis. As the article states, 'If the new US-Russia deal is successful and nothing prevents Trump's invitation, on May 9, 2025, Europeans will symbolically drink a cup of gall, watching Russian soldiers (on Red Square in Moscow - PAP) being greeted by the American president.'
Original language: pl
Publish date: February 21, 2025 06:57 PM
Source:[Bankier.pl](https://www.bankier.pl/wiadomosc/Triumf-Putina-Trump-przyjedzie-do-Rosji-na-obchody-Dnia-Zwyciestwa-9-maja-8896477.html)

**Trump to Visit Moscow on May 9 to Celebrate Ukraine Peace Treaty**
US President Donald Trump is scheduled to visit Moscow on May 9 to celebrate the anniversary of the end of World War II, but the main event will be the signing of a peace treaty with Ukraine. According to French publication Le Point, Russian troops will welcome Trump on the traditional Red Square parade. 'What victory will Vladimir Putin and Donald Trump celebrate on May 9, 2025? Not so much the allies of 1945, but their joint agreement on Ukraine peace talks, which, according to the Kellogg Plan, will end... on May 9,' the article states. This is not Trump's first visit to Moscow for this occasion, but in a different context. In 1995, Bill Clinton visited Boris Yeltsin in Moscow on May 9, despite disagreements on Bosnia, Iran, and NATO expansion. 'If a new agreement between the US and Russia is signed and Trump's invitation is accepted, Europeans will symbolically drain their glasses on May 9, 2025, watching on their screens as Russian troops welcome the American president,' the author concludes. Trump has previously refused to answer questions about whether Russian President Vladimir Putin is responsible for the war in Ukraine, and believes that Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky is also to blame.
Original language: uk
Publish date: February 21, 2025 06:51 PM
Source:[telegraf.com.ua](https://news.telegraf.com.ua/ukr/politika/2025-02-21/5899115-tramp-priedet-k-putinu-9-maya-budut-prazdnovat)

**Donald Trump to Visit Russia on Victory Day, According to French Media**
According to French media, if Donald Trump's plan to visit Russia succeeds, it would be a victory for Putin, who justified the invasion of Ukraine by comparing Ukrainians to Nazis. As stated in a commentary, 'If the new US-Russia deal is successful and nothing prevents Trump's invitation, on May 9, 2025, Europeans will symbolically drink from the cup of gall, watching on their screens Russian soldiers (on Red Square in Moscow -- PAP), who will be greeted by the American president.' This would be a significant blow to European unity and a sign of Russia's growing influence in the region.
Original language: pl
Publish date: February 21, 2025 06:48 PM
Source:[Business Insider](https://businessinsider.com.pl/wiadomosci/francuskie-media-donald-trump-przyjedzie-do-moskwy-na-obchody-dnia-zwyciestwa/yybyb3l)

**Trump Plans to Visit Moscow for Victory Day Celebrations**
According to the French journal Point, US President Donald Trump plans to visit Moscow on May 9 to celebrate Victory Day and meet with Russian President Vladimir Putin. The 80th anniversary of the Soviet Union's victory over Nazi Germany in World War II will be marked in 2025. Trump's visit is seen as a possibility if the new US-Russia agreement is upheld, as stated by the authors of the article. They note that if this happens, Europeans will be left watching on TV as Russian troops are welcomed by the US President. The US and Russia are currently preparing for high-level talks, with a meeting between the two leaders likely to take place at the end of the month. Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov has stated that there is no concrete information on the meeting yet. Meanwhile, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky is reportedly hoping to meet with Trump before Putin, potentially beating his Russian counterpart to the meeting.
Original language: ru
Publish date: February 21, 2025 06:46 PM
Source:[news.ru](https://news.ru/europe/vo-francii-nazvali-neozhidannogo-gostya-na-prazdnovanii-dnya-pobedy-v-moskve/)

**Donald Trump to Visit Russia on Victory Day, Symbolizing Defeat for Europe**
According to a recent article, Donald Trump is planning to visit Russia on Victory Day (May 9th) in 2025. The article suggests that this would be a victory for Vladimir Putin, who has compared Ukrainians to Nazis to justify his invasion of Ukraine. If a new US-Russia deal is reached, it would be a symbolic defeat for Europeans, who would be forced to watch Russian soldiers on TV, including those on Red Square in Moscow, as Trump praises them. As the article notes, 'What victory will Putin and Donald Trump be celebrating on May 9, 2025? Not the one achieved by the Allies in 1945, but their own, joint victory, in the negotiations on Ukraine, which, according to the plan (special envoy of US President Donald Trump, Keith Kellogg) would be finalized... on May 9.'
Original language: pl
Publish date: February 21, 2025 06:38 PM
Source:[Business Insider](https://businessinsider.com.pl/wiadomosci/donald-trump-przyjedzie-do-rosji-na-obchody-dnia-zwyciestwa/yybyb3l)

**Russian and US Officials to Meet in Riyadh to Discuss Relations and Ukraine**
High-level Russian and US officials will meet in Riyadh on Tuesday to discuss improving relations, a possible ceasefire in Ukraine, and a summit between Vladimir Putin and Donald Trump. Kremlin Spokesman Dmitri Peskov announced that Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov and Putin's deputy Yuri Ushakov will travel to Riyadh on Monday. Peskov stated that the meetings will 'primarily focus on restoring the overall complex of Russian-American relations.' He also mentioned that they will discuss several security issues and 'separate discussions on possible negotiations for a solution in Ukraine and organizing a meeting between the two heads of state.' Peskov also announced that an American citizen who was detained at Moscow Airport on Friday on suspicion of bringing contraband has been released. Peskov said, 'Given that the relations will be re-established on Tuesday, these events can be evaluated in this context.' Russia had previously requested that NATO withdraw its troops from some Eastern European countries before launching a large-scale military operation in Ukraine in February 2022. US Secretary of State Marco Rubio is also traveling to Riyadh to attend the meetings, which will be accompanied by Trump's National Security Adviser Mike Waltz and the White House's Middle East Special Envoy Steve Witkoff. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky will visit Saudi Arabia on Wednesday, a day after the meeting between Russian and US officials. Zelensky's spokesperson Sergiy Nikiforov stated that Zelensky will visit Saudi Arabia as part of a 'long-planned' official visit with his wife. US President Trump had announced last week that he and Putin had agreed to start negotiations on ending the Ukraine war during a phone call.
Original language: tr
Publish date: February 17, 2025 12:27 PM
Source:[Deutsche Welle](https://www.dw.com/tr/rus-ve-abdli-yetkililer-riyadda-bulu%C5%9Facak/a-71638546)

**Stepashin Predicts Trump's Visit to Russia Will Be a Sensation**
Former Russian Prime Minister Sergey Stepanov expressed confidence that Russian President Vladimir Putin and US President Donald Trump will meet before May 9th this year. Stepanov believes that their meeting will be a significant event, saying, 'If Trump comes to Russia on Victory Day, that will be a sensation.' Stepanov noted that both leaders prioritize their countries and have found common ground due to their shared approach to decision-making, which he described as, 'A person says - a person does.' The two leaders discussed Ukraine, agreeing on the need for peaceful negotiations to resolve the conflict. Trump invited Putin to visit the US, and Putin extended an invitation to Trump to visit Moscow during their phone call on February 12th.
Original language: ru
Publish date: February 15, 2025 10:23 PM
Source:[Российская газета](https://rg.ru/2025/02/16/stepashin-zaiavil-chto-priezd-trampa-v-rossiiu-na-den-pobedy-proizvedet-furor.html)

**Russia Anticipates a 'Furore' if Trump Visits on Victory Day**
Former Russian Prime Minister Sergey Stepanov announced a 'furore' if US President Donald Trump were to visit Russia on Victory Day, May 9, 2025. Stepanov expects a meeting between Russian President Vladimir Putin and Trump to take place before May 9, similar to last year. 'If Trump were to come to Victory Day, that would be a furore,' he said. Stepanov believes that the two presidents have similar priorities, with a focus on their respective countries, and that they understand each other and take their statements seriously. Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov previously stated that Putin is willing to welcome Trump at the Victory Day parade on May 9.
Original language: ru
Publish date: February 15, 2025 09:36 PM
Source:[Lenta.ru](https://lenta.ru/news/2025/02/16/v-rossii-anonsirovali-furor-v-sluchae-priezda-trampa-na-den-pobedy/)

**US Special Envoy to Ukraine May Visit Russia Before Putin-Trump Meeting**
US special envoy to Ukraine, Kit Kellog, may visit Russia before the meeting between Russian President Vladimir Putin and US President-elect Donald Trump, according to Americanist and political scientist Malak Dudakov. Dudakov stated that all diplomatic activity will begin after Trump's inauguration on January 20. 'It's too early to judge and speculate, we will first see the activity of diplomats', Dudakov said. He did not rule out the possibility that Moscow and Washington could find common ground on issues related to the Ukrainian conflict, but also noted that the complex situation in Russia-West relations will likely persist. Trump previously stated that the conflict on Ukraine was sparked by the administration of US President Joe Biden, and emphasized that Russia launched the Special Military Operation because his predecessor and his allies were incompetent.
Original language: ru
Publish date: January 13, 2025 02:54 PM
Source:[Аргументы и факты](https://aif.ru/politics/politolog-dudakov-kellog-mozhet-priehat-v-rf-do-vstrechi-putina-i-trampa)

**Putin to Discuss New National Projects on January 9**
Russian President Putin will discuss the launch of new national projects on January 9. Deputy Prime Minister Alexander Novak will present a report on the topic. According to the Kremlin, 'a number of current issues will also be considered.' Previously, Putin spoke with 9th-grader Arina Porhal from Gorlovka via phone, fulfilling her wish to visit St. Petersburg as part of the 'Christmas Tree of Wishes' charity event. US President-elect Donald Trump stated that he is aware of Putin's willingness to engage in dialogue, but believes that negotiations can only take place after his inauguration. Trump noted that he cannot yet specify the exact date for the proposed dialogue with Putin.
Original language: ru
Publish date: January 08, 2025 12:26 PM
Source:[360.ru](https://360.ru/news/vlast/putin-9-janvarja-obsudit-zapusk-novyh-natsproektov/)

**Trump Aims to Negotiate Peace Agreement between Ukraine and Russia before Easter**
Former US President Donald Trump plans to negotiate a peace agreement between Ukraine and Russia before Easter, according to Robert Clark, a scientific associate at the Yorktown Institute. Clark stated, 'It will be incredibly difficult for Ukraine. I think the American side will certainly aim to conclude any agreement by Easter. It all depends on how willing Vladimir Putin is to make concessions, especially in areas like Kursk, and how willing President Volodymyr Zelensky is to make concessions.' The agreement may be signed by April 20, 2025. Trump has appointed General Keith Kellogg as a special representative to resolve the conflict between Ukraine and Russia. Kellogg is expected to visit Ukraine after Trump takes office. According to Kellogg's plan, the front line will be frozen by stopping fire and introducing a demilitarized zone. Russia will receive limited sanctions relief in exchange for its agreement, and full relief will only be granted after the signing of a peace agreement acceptable to Ukraine. Ukraine was not asked to give up its claim to occupied territories, but it must achieve this through diplomatic means. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky stated that before any possible negotiations with Russia, he plans to discuss with President Trump how to jointly stop Putin. Zelensky emphasized that Ukraine's position will be crucial for European partners, as the war is taking place on Ukrainian territory, and Ukraine has the right to the loudest voice in these negotiations. 'We will agree with Trump, and after that, there can be a conversation with the Russians,' Zelensky said.

summary: After analyzing the initial and revised probabilities from various experts, it is concluded that the likelihood of Donald Trump visiting Russia before April 1, 2025, is extremely low. Initially, experts considered historical visit patterns, geopolitical tensions, and personal interests, resulting in low initial probabilities ranging from 0% to 15%. After reviewing news articles, which confirmed Trump's focus on other international engagements, particularly in Saudi Arabia, and his explicit statements ruling out a visit to Russia, all experts revised their probabilities to 0%. Therefore, the consensus is that Trump is not expected to visit Russia within the given timeframe.
